title: Can We Talk About the Kindred Rework?
body:
Most of the Kindred mains on Reddit are upset.  Their play rate jumped up at patch time, then disappeared again.  Their win rate has tanked to almost 45% overall.

They're not a more healthy champ, they're not a more balanced champ, they just suck.  Can we skip the months of people finding new mains and complaining, and just revert the changes and go back to the drawing board?

replies.body:
We have a very recent example of why they will not do that. {{champion:154}} 

People called for reverts because he was weak at first. They changed a few small numbers and he was OP. Yeah, she'll need some work, probably, but just because the first iteration didn't work does NOT mean a revert is needed.

kindred didnt change nearly as much as zac did

crit carries don't work on jungle income, especially one who isn't good with any of the upgraded jungle items

A fair counter-point. 

I maintain that there are ways to tune her other than a revert. Got any ideas on that end, or are you very much in favor of the revert, also?

idk what to do with her, honestly. this version of kindred would have been much more successful in any jungle besides s7's jungle, where power-farming for a late game spike was actually feasible

just from playing her a lot, it'd be nice to have an early game worth a shit; as it is, Kindred can't duel anyone without 2 or 3 items, her ganks are mediocre, and her clear speed leaves more to be desired. she's not as reliant on getting marks to be relevant later on, but she's set back just as hard by invading her and taking her camps, so she's still very feast/famine
Would a jungle item with crit chance be helpful?

That wouldn't be a good idea, a jungle item with crit could easily be abused by many champs, not to mention that if its cost and power are good enough we could see again champs taking smite to lane. Adcs taking smite to get that item would be a nightmare, especially if they go true damage smite.
{{champion:104}} _Crit jungle? Keep talkin'._

I posted exactly this and no one listened.

Sigh..

I think her E interaction with crit will prove this statement wrong if and only if she's brought up to respectable base numbers. 

She needs the ability to duel early, her kit allows that, her numbers don't. She's always going to suck because the minute she can duel early she scales way to fucking  hard and it's release kindred all over, pick or ban.
She shouldn't have been made a crit champion, they need to change that.
How exactly are they a "crit champion?" They're about as much as one as Garen or Quinn.

Most of {{champion:203}} dmg comes from their E now, which itself does little dmg unless you proc execute who's threshold is tied to crit. AA's deal little dmg and W is negligible so w/out some lucky burst you're pretty screwed

Crit on {{champion:133}} and {{champion:86}} open up their possible build paths, not pigeonhole them

I don't get how "they do shit damage all around" brings people to the conclusion to "they're forced to build crit" over "they really need a numbers buff." Especially since Zac's rework had the exact same problem only a while ago, and fixing that fixed him _too_ hard.

Similar thing happened with Aatrox, too. At first, the Aatrox changes left him as complete garbage, but Riot was being careful and slowly gave him buffs. Now he's sitting at a 51% winrate Plat+. People just need to give Riot some time to tune Kindred.

Indeed. Help me talk sense into them lol.

But they're right about one thing. She isn't in a good spot yet.
Which is why she has a few buffs on the PBE.

Yes. That's how these things go. I prefer this, actually, to the alternative, where kindred requires a ban until they fix her. A smaller subset of the community is addled this way.

That's not to say it doesn't suck for kindred mains. It does. But again, the alternative is that she's OP, and then they can't play her AND everyone has to ban her.

It would have been nice if they didn't give us a reworked version of a completely stat-gutted champion to begin with? Like..buff her numbers if you're going to remove her kit's last remaining strength, idiots, wtf hello? And even now that they are approaching buffs, they're being such pussies about it, when they swung the nerf hammer over Kindred's heads hard over and over and over unapologetically. I just don't understand.

they play an adc champion on jungle .. why do they even cry about? lol 
it's like playing  sona vs jayce top and saying sona gets 1 shot "omg she is weak" ^__^

That comparison is wrong on so many levels.
Sona is designed to be a support, part of a duo lane. When she is going in a solo lane dominated mostly by champions excelling at dueling, of course she is going to have a bad time.

But Kindred are designed to be a jungler. It's not like they were designed to be a bot lane ADC for a duo lane and people just want to take them to the jungle. And if a champion is clearly underperforming in the position he was created for in the first place, something needs to happen.

To be fair. {{champion:7}} was designed to be an assassin. {{champion:432}} was designed to be a care taking roaming sup. {{champion:104}} was designed to be an adc. {{champion:82}} was designed to be an adc. etc.

Leblanc, granted, she shifted from assassin to burst mage/kite mage. She actually needs further changes to function in this game, too.

Bard, I don't really get that example. He still is a care taking roaming sup. What is different in your eyes?

Like explained above, I would like if they try to shift Graves back to bot lane with some changes. But since he works in the jungle, it seems they just embraced it.

Mordekaiser was an experiment which obviously failed. Hence why he is in need of a VGU and in tier 1 for it.

Kindred don't work in any role right now.... and if there is no role they function in, why not make changes to buff their intended role.

I listed Bard because he was turned into a kill lane sup when his theme of being a "caretaker" fell flat on it's face at release. 
> Mordekaiser was an experiment which obviously failed.

This is honestly how i see kindred lol Thematically it makes sense for her to be a jg, but they forced a really bad gimmick(aka "adc jg") on her instead of letting her character/fun gameplay determine her kit. Mord was really just the same, but opposite. A melee forced into a ranged champs role vs a ranged champ forced into a (almost entirely)melee champs role. It's also really pathetic when you realize that there are ranged champs(both adc's), that were never meant to be jgs are better at it than her({{champion:104}} {{champion:29}} )

Riot has this weird way of intentionally doing something for the better and unintentionally doing the opposite.

Idk how it happens... But i think thats one nice things about riot... They imbrace the unexpected.

It's essentially the hedonism paradox "Pursuing happiness make you miserable, where pursuing something else makes you happy". When riot just tries to think about what's fun or what works on a champ, it usually turns out very well {{champion:19}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:102}} etc. when they go in with an objective/gimmick that they want to force into the game It turns out horribly. for reference see; all class updates/plants/dragons/jg camp changes etc.

Plants actually ended up pretty okay for what people were expecting. They're not RNG and are actually mini-objectives at this point, with the honey plants and your accessibility to them being the real RNG. It's not abusable anymore so eh.

I think for Kindred though, she was overnerfed to begin with and they just added more on top to the early game which was already feast or famine. She can still see success, but it is definitely all-or-nothing WAY more than before. They essentially supported the gimmick while amplifying requirements, which they also did with Shyvana. However, Shyvana only had one ability changed and it was admittedly one of the most useless ones. Kindred got her most useless ability in fights (W) turn into an itty-bitty poke used mostly for clearing (and not all that fast either). It had way more potential behind it for what it could've turned into.

how is he designed to be a jungler? lol  
only his passive proves that he should be top/bot lol

Are you talking about Kindred?
The passive clearly tells that they are intended as a jungler.

You get marks by killing jungle creatures in the enemies jungle, aka counter-jungling, which is mostly done by the jungler in your team.
And you get marks by chosing target in the interface to kill in the next time, basically telling you "this champion is supposed to **gank** alot", again, mostly done by the jungler.

Could you explain to me how you came up with the idea that Kindreds passive implies to be a top/bot laner?

> [{quoted}](name=SatomiKun,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ohR3gYPg,comment-id=00000000,htimestamp=2017-06-11T11:50:18.256+0000)
>
> That comparison is wrong on so many levels.
> Sona is designed to be a support, part of a duo lane. When she is going in a solo lane dominated mostly by champions excelling at dueling, of course she is going to have a bad time.
> 
> But Kindred are designed to be a jungler. It's not like they were designed to be a bot lane ADC for a duo lane and people just want to take them to the jungle. And if a champion is clearly underperforming in the position he was created for in the first place, something needs to happen.

*cough* Graves *cough*

Since I play Graves bot lane myself, I would be glad if Riot tried to buff that playstyle to promote him going in that lane again. I saw a interesting suggestion to make his Q deal bonus damage against minions, so he is able to wave clear early on and doesn't get pushed in as often.

Besides: At least Graves was performing well in a role.... it wasn't the role they expected, but he shifted to the jungle and since he was doing well there, they simply embraced that shift.

But Kindred are just underperforming everywhere. And if that is the case, they should simply buff the playstyle they were intended for the whole time.

the range scaling is garbage,its barely noticeable.
kindred is not an adc she is a jungle champion she was CREATED to be PLAYED in the JUNGLE not botlane.
Riot needs to give back some of that old sustain they used to have.
Or at least some jungle-based sustain.  Healing on monsters only.

They're actually really well sustained if you kite the monsters properly. Blue buff in particular can barely damage you compared to Red buff, which is why getting a leash for Red buff yields an overall healthier clear. I use Warlord's Bloodlust for the crit build gimmick, and it definitely works until you really need mid game damage.

I said so many times that Kindred don't live their fantasy.

At this point, you should rename the champion to:  ''Lamb and the talking zone and empowered auto attack that look like a spirit hunting wolf''.

What's the point of having two opposite beings in one champion if one is just following the other around and **sometimes** interact in battle?

Kindred just feels terrible to play, i have never played squishier champion in my life. I feel safer playing ashe than her (yeah i call kindred "her" since its a fucking goat and wolf is non existent)

Kindred needs a re-release IMO. Her kit does nothing for her fantasy of "embodiment of death" on top of being a balance nightmare. So many champs have kits that not only do her theme better, but are also just... better... {{champion:19}} {{champion:28}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:164}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:2}} just to name a few. Even if riot manages to tweak her number just right™ to where she become balanced, her gameplay will still be underwhelming at best.

I slightly disagree here.
If Kindred really become a late game hypercarry ala Jinx/Kog'Maw/Twitch with the stack mechanic, it fulfills the fantasy of the "embodiment of death" in my opinion.

Giving you the feeling like you are running against time. You can delay death, but you can't stop it entirely. Some day, all of us will die. That can be well represented by giving them a hypercarry power curve.
But Camilles theme of being thicc is already fullfilled.
https://i.imgflip.com/r7sys.jpg

I think the problem with Kindred's rework is they changed up her play pattern and failed to fix her biggest issue.

The problem with the play pattern is her damage used to be focused on her AAs, but now it scales better on her skills.  This isn't a big difference, but it's there.  Her autos also used to get better damage and now they get better safety.  The other problem is she's always been a bit of a win-more champion, in that from how her passive works, she's either going to snowball or be snowballed against.  Riot didn't fix that, they didn't do anything to make it easier for her to get back into the game, and for her autos, they made it worse by making her need 4 stacks to get a little bit safer.  


If I could sum up the problem with Kindred as a jungler is that she's very team dependent instead of being a jungler that enables her team.  That's why I call her a win more champ.

Hmm.

Maybe have her marks start to appear in her own jungle if her outer ring of towers is down? That's when you really lose the opportunity to go into the enemy jungle, and it becomes equally risky to enter your own...
I think something like this would really improve her quality of life.

Maybe limit it to the first four-five marks, as well - enough so she can possibly catch up to her biggest power jump (4 marks and 575 range), but not enough so she suddenly gets access to too easy a mark in a game of tower trades.
Twitch is a better jungler than Kindred now lol.... it's not even fair because lane kindred is even worse than before to.
Kindred is just too easy to shut down with their passive; the enemy jungler has such a head start unless Kindred is camping in the enemy jungle and neglecting their own.

Kindred's rework was doomed to fail since the very beginning, because the concept of forcing junglers into crit builds is flawed.

**Junglers can't wait for late game to be relevant**, they need to impact the game during the laning phase if they want to carry.

How is a jungler (a role with low gold income) supposed to be a threat when they have little to no utility and their damage starts spiking only after 3 items (jungle item + tier 2 boots + crit item)?
adcs who build on hit items usualy build{{item:3085}} ,crit on kindred is inevitable.
You did not understand a thing of what I said.

Firstly:kindred does not build hurricane for the crit,she does so for the on hit effects and faster clear.
Secondly:there are 3 ways to build an adc:
crit
on hit
lehtality
you just dont know the diference between on hit and crit adcs,just because she builds hurricane does not mean shes a crit adc.
